Remove bundled ConfigObj library

name: v1.1.2
body: Minor changes for packaging.

name: v1.1.1
body:
This release has focused on improving the code base, and ease of packaging.

Notable Changes:
Move from Optparse to Argparse. This means the 'help' command has been removed, as holland <command> --help will do the same thing.

Fix bug that was preventing the `inline` compression configuration options from working as expected.
Updated mysqldump plugin to respect inline compression option. This mean if a user has `inline=no` configuration, their backup may no require more space to complete. As Holland will wait for mysqldump to finish before compressing the output.

Add historic-size option. This will run by default and will try to use the last backup size as an estimate of today's size. If there isn't a backup, it's missing the the size information, or the database is more the 1.5(configurable) times larger, hollland will use the estimate-size-factor list it traditional does.

name: Holland v1.1.0
body:
# 1.1.0 - Jun 8, 2018

## Holland
- Update Holland to work on Python 3. It's now using compatibility library to support Python version > 2.6
- Update packaged version of ConfigObj to 5.0.6
- holland now has a few external dependencies:
  * future
  * six
- Implemented fix for broken stop-slave function on MySQL 5.7+ (Fixes GH#185 jacripe)
- Remove holland.backup.maatkit and holland.backup.mysqlhotcopy from active backup list
- Add 'format' option to 'logging' in /etc/holland/holland.conf (GH#99).
  This uses the current log formatter if 'format' not defined.

## holland-mysqldump
- Add dir archive-method (GH Pull #184 chder)
- bin-log-position will now record the masters position even if stop-slave isn't enabled
- Update stop/start slave fuctions

## holland-xtrabackup
- Print out xtrabackup version number

## holland-mariabackup
- Add plugin to allow use of mariabackup binary

## holland-mongodb
- Add plugin to allow holland to backup mongodb

name: Holland 1.0.14
body:
# 1.0.14 - Nov 17, 2016

## holland
- A fix for launchpad bug #1220841 caused plugins that used
  "SHOW SLAVE STATUS" via the holland mysql lib to fail with
  an "unknown encoding: binary" error.  The changes for
  LP #1220841 have been reverted.

## holland-mysqldump
- A bug was introduced in 1.0.12 which caused mysqldump's lock-method
  "auto-detect" option to always use lock-tables under MySQL 5.0
  environments. (Fixes GH#148)
